summary: This is a Federal Bureau of Prisons press release announcing the death of inmate Jeffrey Edward Epstein at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 10, 2019. It states he was found unresponsive in his cell, transported to a hospital, and pronounced dead, with the FBI investigating the incident as an apparent suicide.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The inmate found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, transported to a hospital and pronounced dead. He was under pretrial status for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

events.title: Epstein found unresponsive and dies
events.description: Jeffrey Edward Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at approximately 6:30 a.m. Life-saving measures were initiated, he was transported to a local hospital, and was subsequently pronounced dead.

events.title: Epstein arrives at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey Edward Epstein arrived at the Metropolitan Correctional Center under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), New York, New York
keyFacts: Jeffrey Edward Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York on August 10, 2019, at approximately 6:30 a.m.
He was transported to a local hospital and pronounced dead, with the FBI investigating the incident as an apparent suicide.
Epstein arrived at MCC New York on July 6, 2019, under pretrial status after being indicted for sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.
The MCC New York is described as an Administrative security facility housing 763 male offenders.
